title: Taking meaningful climate action, an absolute imperative

title: In South Korea, fans celebrate end of military service for K-pop's BTS
subhead: The mandatory military service of the members of the world's most famous K-pop group sparked intense debate in South Korea, even leading to the adoption of a law allowing stars to postpone enlistment until age 30 to protect their careers.

title: Venice locals protest three-day Jeff Bezos wedding extravaganza
subhead: Residents of La Serenissima have formed a group to oppose the wedding of Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and journalist Lauren Sanchez, who have planned a ceremony set to take place between Thursday and Saturday.

title: For Gulf monarchies, Israel has replaced Iran as Middle East's main destabilizing force
subhead: Israel's increasingly aggressive stance has sparked anxiety and anger in the palaces of the Arabian Peninsula. Elites in the region, who fear reprisals against US military bases on their soil, have called for a diplomatic resolution to the Iranian nuclear issue.

title: 'A furnace': Life under Paris's zinc roofs during a heatwave
subhead: On Saturday, the French capital faced a heatwave, with temperatures reaching up to 36°C. The residents of the city's 'chambres de bonne,' small top-floor flats, struggled to cope.

title: The Heritage Foundation sets its sights on Europe
subhead: Since the beginning of his term, Donald Trump has been applying Project 2025, a 922-page bible written by the conservative think tank. Today, its president, Kevin Roberts, is looking across the Atlantic. On a visit to France, he met with leaders of far-right parties.
